title: Game 7, anyone? The key factors behind a trio of NBA playoff Game 6s
content: Three matchups have extended to Game 6s in the first round. What does each team need to do to advance or stay alive?

title: What a championship for these 10 playoff teams would say about the NBA
content: From the Celtics to the Thunder, here's how potential titles could lead into varied versions of an NBA future.

title: Haliburton's dad to stay away from Pacers games
content: After conversations with the Pacers' front office, Tyrese Haliburton's father, John, will not attend the team's home and road games for the foreseeable future, a Pacers spokesperson told ESPN.

title: Suns tab Gregory as GM, make Jones sr. adviser
content: The Phoenix Suns are promoting vice president Brian Gregory to be the franchise's new general manager as James Jones transitions to a role as senior adviser for the organization, the team announced Thursday.

title: Lakers' early playoff exit a blow to betting public
content: Entering the playoffs, more money had been wagered on the Lakers to win the Finals than on any other team at multiple sportsbooks. That money will be staying with the house.

title: Yanks shift Stanton to 60-day IL with tendinitis
content: The Yankees moved designated hitter Giancarlo Stanton to the 60-day injured list and claimed outfielder Bryan De La Cruz off waivers from the Braves.

title: Reds demote struggling ex-closer Diaz to minors
content: The Reds optioned reliever Alexis Diaz to Louisville on Friday and called up fellow right-hander Luis Mey from the Triple-A club.

title: Wins put Spurs, Man Utd on brink of unlikely final
content: Big wins for Man United and Tottenham in the Europa League semifinals kept alive their hopes of lifting a major trophy and qualifying for the Champions League.

title: Villanova lands Lewis, top available PG recruit
content: Acaden Lewis, the top available point guard in the 2025 class, told ESPN that he has committed to Villanova.

title: '27 QB prospect Taylor commits to Cornhuskers
content: Quarterback Trae Taylor, one of the top pocket passers in the 2027 recruiting class, announced his commitment to Nebraska over Illinois, LSU and Texas A&M.

title: ðŸ“ˆ MLB Power Rankings: Who sits atop our list?
content: The NL is still dominating MLB -- and our rankings -- while an AL East team continues to tumble down the Week 5 list.

title: Is Anthony Stolarz the Maple Leafs' goaltending savior?
content: The Maple Leafs' recent playoff goaltending history is rough. Have they found a solution? How far can he take them?

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: How many teams will force a Game 7?
content: All four matchups are at 3-2. Will the leading teams advance -- or will the series extend? Get prepared here.

title: Which NFL teams already need a QB for 2026? Reidâ€™s first-round mock draft has four in the top 10
content: Four QBs in the top 10? Two big trades? Let's make way-too-early predictions for every pick of next year's first round.

title: If parity is NWSL's 'superpower' vs. Europe competition, is expansion its kryptonite?
content: The NWSL has excitement that the UEFA Women's Champions League and England's WSL can't match -- but how long will it last?

title: NBA draft lottery 101: Date, time, odds, format, history
content: The 2025 NBA draft lottery takes place on May 12. Check out details on the event's format, rules, history and more.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal closed and the draft ended. Who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: 2024-25 report cards for every Big East team (plus a few others)
content: How should UConn be graded after falling short of its third straight national title? Our verdicts on each team.

title: Top 10 transfer portal winners: SEC leads the pack
content: Whether remaking rosters or filling needs, Tennessee, Ole Miss, South Carolina and LSU won the transfer portal.

title: Transfer rankings: All eyes on Kneepkens, Williams
content: Ta'Niya Latson tops the rankings, while Gianna Kneepkens and Serah Williams still have decisions to make.

title: Times Square fights: How boxing is failing its rank and file boxers
content: On a weekend where Ryan Garcia and Canelo Alvarez are stealing the spotlight, the sport is failing its true boxers.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Sandhagen gets past Figueiredo at UFC Fight Night
content: Cory Sandhagen and Deiveson Figueiredo headline UFC Fight Night from Des Moines, Iowa, and PFL World Tournament first-round action concludes with heavyweights and light heavyweights.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Breaking down European semifinals: Arsenal vs. PSG, Barcelona vs. Inter predictions
content: The Champions League, Europa League and Europa Conference League are thrilling as we hit the semifinals. Can Arsenal fight back vs. PSG? Let's break down all the first legs and project what's to come.

title: Sources: Brazil give Ancelotti May 26 deadline
content: The Brazilian Football Confederation (CBF) on Thursday extended its deadline for Carlo Ancelotti to take over as national team coach, sources told ESPN.

title: City get boost as Rodri, Haaland back in training
content: Manchester City midfielder Rodri has returned to training for the first time since suffering a serious knee injury in September, manager Pep Guardiola said on Thursday.

title: Inzaghi: Phenoms like Yamal 'born every 50 years'
content: Inter coach Simone Inzaghi lauded Barcelona's Lamine Yamal as a phenomenon who comes along once every 50 years after his side's draw in the Champions League.

title: Sources: BarÃ§a's Kounde to miss Inter 2nd leg
content: Barcelona have confirmed defender Jules Kounde suffered a hamstring injury in Wednesday's 3-3 Champions League semifinal draw against Inter Milan, with sources telling ESPN he will miss the second leg in Italy next week.

title: Caps keep Messi in check, bounce Miami from cup
content: Brian White and Pedro Vite scored two minutes apart and the Vancouver Whitecaps stunned Inter Miami 3-1 in the second leg of their Concacaf Champions Cup semifinal on Wednesday night.

title: Mascherano laments Miami's 'hurtful' CCC exit
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps dashed Lionel Messi's hopes of reaching the Concacaf Champions Cup final by stunning Inter Miami 5-1 on aggregate score.

title: Source: City eye possible Ederson replacements
content: Manchester City are monitoring a number of goalkeepers including FC Porto's Diogo Costa amid renewed uncertainty surrounding Ederson's future, a source has told ESPN.

title: FA to ban transgender players in women's soccer
content: The English Football Association (FA) has said it will ban transgender players from women's football from next season, starting on June 1.

title: LeBron, Messi and Ronaldo: Three GOATs' pursuits of titles come to end on Wednesday
content: The stars didn't align on Wednesday for the Lakers, Al Nassr and Inter Miami stars, whom all were eliminated the same day.

title: Baker Mayfield takes first-round Bucs pick Emeka Egbuka and family out to brunch
content: Tampa Bay selected Egbuka, a wide receiver from Ohio State, with the 19th pick the 2025 NFL draft last week.

title: Draft tiers at forward/center
content: Andre Snellings goes through the different tiers at the forward/center position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet Central
content: Our collection of downloadable, printable cheat sheets for the 2025 fantasy football season, including PPR, non-PPR and dynasty/keeper leagues.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Real Madrid's running battle with referees: How did it start? When will it end?
content: Madrid's anger escalated in the Copa del Rey final, with an official in tears and three players sent off.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Leverkusen want Wirtz to Man City, Real Madrid over Bayern
content: Bayer Leverkusen are desperate for Florian Wirtz to move to Manchester City or Real Madrid over Bayern. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Trump makes Rubio interim NSA, nominates Mike Waltz for UN ambassador
content: President Trump announced Marco Rubio as the interim National Security Advisor, succeeding Mike Waltz, while also nominating Waltz as the United Nations Ambassador. Waltz's departure follows criticism and reports of staff dismissals within the National Security Council. Trump expressed confidence in both Rubio and Waltz to prioritize national interests and enhance global safety in their respective roles.

title: HC warns Ramdev of contempt, says take down video targeting Rooh Afza
content: The Delhi high court has found Yoga guru Ramdev in contempt for defying an earlier undertaking regarding disparaging remarks against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. The court expressed concern over Ramdev's lack of control and ordered him to remove an offensive social media video within 24 hours.

title: Dravid can't hide disappointment as Suryavanshi falls for a duck
content: After a record-breaking century in the previous game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Rajasthan Royals' young star, had a disappointing outing, dismissed for a duck against Mumbai Indians. Mumbai Indians capitalized on favorable batting conditions, with Rohit Sharma and Ryan Rickelton setting up a strong foundation. Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya's explosive innings propelled MI to a formidable total of 217.

title: Trump threatens to impose sanctions against nations buying oil from Iran
content: Donald Trump threatened sanctions on Iranian oil buyers, halting US business ties, after nuclear talks were delayed. Oman cited logistical reasons for postponing the meeting, while Iran affirmed commitment to a fair agreement. Tensions rise amid stalled negotiations, with the US hinting at military action and Iran considering nuclear weapons development.

title: Amazon CEO to business leaders on Trump tariffs: At the end of the day, we...
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy advises business leaders to prioritize customer focus amidst tariff and geopolitical uncertainties. He acknowledges the challenging environment created by tariffs but emphasizes fulfilling the core mission of understanding and delivering what customers want. Jassy believes concentrating on controllable factors and customer needs positions companies for success, despite external pressures.

title: Acquitted by Guj judge in 1994, man sent to jail by SC for raping 10-yr-old
content: In a landmark decision, the Supreme Court overturned a trial court's acquittal of a man for sexually assaulting a 10-year-old girl 32 years ago. The apex court upheld a Gujarat High Court ruling, sentencing the now 54-year-old convict to 10 years in prison. The SC criticized the initial acquittal, highlighting the overwhelming evidence against the accused.

title: Google CEO makes an â€˜Apple announcementâ€™ under oath, says Tim Cook wasâ€¦
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai confirmed under oath that Gemini, its AI chatbot, is expected to be integrated into Siri by mid-2025, following discussions with Apple CEO Tim Cook. This integration, rumored since last year, aims to enhance Siri's AI capabilities, potentially allowing it to handle complex queries. The partnership would significantly expand Gemini's reach across Apple devices.

title: IPL: Rickelton, Karn shine as MI throw RR out of playoffs race
content: Mumbai Indians defeated Rajasthan Royals by 100 runs in a spectacular IPL 2025 match. Ryan Rickelton's powerful 61 and Karn Sharma's effective bowling were key to Mumbai's sixth consecutive win. Rickelton's aggressive batting set a strong foundation. Sharma's disciplined bowling dismantled Rajasthan's batting lineup. Mumbai Indians strengthened their playoff chances with this victory.

title: Upset Pichai calls US govt proposal to break Google: 'So far-reaching, so â€¦'
content: Sundar Pichai voiced strong objections to the DOJ's proposed remedies in Google's antitrust case, cautioning they could cripple Google Search and jeopardize user privacy. He argued that demands to share search data and potentially sell Chrome would undermine innovation and devalue Google's investments. Pichai also highlighted privacy risks associated with the data-sharing proposal.

title: Take measures to protect vulnerable people from heat: NHRC to 11 states
content: The National Human Rights Commission has urged authorities nationwide to protect vulnerable populations from rising heatwave dangers. Citing NCRB data showing 3,798 heat-related deaths between 2018 and 2022, the NHRC has directed 11 states, including Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra, to implement preemptive measures. These include providing shelters, adjusting work hours, and ensuring treatment for heat illnesses.

title: 'Iss baar ghar mein ghus kar baith jana': Owaisi urges govt to takeover PoK
content: Asaduddin Owaisi urged the BJP government to move beyond rhetoric and take decisive action against Pakistan by focusing on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). He reminded the government of the Parliament's resolution asserting India's claim over PoK. Owaisi highlighted past terror attacks and emphasized the need to eradicate terrorism, noting a national consensus among opposition parties on the issue.

title: Is this the end of Yuzvendra Chahal's Team India career?
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's exclusion from the BCCI's annual contracts sparks questions about his future with Team India. Astrologer Greenstone Lobo attributes this dip to Pluto's shift into the "Grey Lizard Avatar," signifying transformation. Despite competition from younger talents like Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav, Chahal's dedication suggests continued success in the IPL and other tournaments.

title: Trump fires NSA Waltz as churn continues in his second term
content: President Trump is reportedly dismissing National Security Advisor Michael Waltz after a security breach involving a journalist in a Signal chat. This comes amidst a pattern of high turnover in key positions during Trump's administrations, making it difficult for international counterparts like India's NSA Ajit Doval to build stable relationships.

title: UK urges India, Pak to de-escalate situation, says it's â€˜incredibly dangerousâ€™
content: Amidst rising tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, the UK government is calling for de-escalation and dialogue. A Tory peer has urged Britain to directly intervene by appointing a special emissary to facilitate discussions. Concerns have also been raised regarding protests in London, including a Pakistani diplomat's threatening gesture towards Indian demonstrators.

title: Another Nepali girl found dead in hostel room of Bhubaneswar university
content: In Bhubaneswar, a Nepalese student was found dead in her hostel room at a private university, marking the second such incident in two and a half months. Police have confirmed the death as a suicide and are investigating the circumstances.

title: Memes break internet as 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi flops in RR vs MI
content: Teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi experienced a dramatic turn of events in the IPL 2025. After a record-breaking century, he was dismissed for a duck against Mumbai Indians, triggering a wave of social media reactions. Mumbai Indians set a formidable target of 217/2, putting Rajasthan Royals under pressure, further intensifying after Vaibhav's early dismissal, and RR's chase looked shaky.

title: Pahalgam fallout: Why Xi may not come to rescue of 'China's Israel'
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, China offers Pakistan diplomatic support but signals limited intervention, prioritizing its own strategic interests. Despite the proclaimed all-weather friendship, Beijing's focus remains on internal stability, managing trade tensions, and de-escalating with India. Pakistan's reliance on China for unconditional support may be a miscalculation, as Beijing balances regional dynamics and its own priorities.

title: Millions for bosses, peanuts for workers: Salary of CEOs spike by 50% since 2019
content: A recent Oxfam report reveals a stark disparity in income growth, with global CEO pay soaring by 50% since 2019 to $4.3 million annually, while average worker wages have barely budged, increasing only 0.9% over the same period. This widening gap exacerbates financial struggles for workers, particularly in regions like India, where living wages fall short of decent living expenses.

title: Rohit Sharma's record leaves Dhoni and Raina behind by a mile
content: Rohit Sharma achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second player to surpass 6000 runs for a single T20 franchise, Mumbai Indians, during the IPL 2025 match against Rajasthan Royals. He trails only Virat Kohli in this record. Rohit leads a list that includes legends like James Vince (Hampshire), Suresh Raina (CSK), and MS Dhoni (CSK).

title: 'Apparent betrayal': Turmoil in BJP as Dilip Ghosh visits Mamataâ€™s event
content: A controversy has erupted within the Bengal BJP as senior leader Dilip Ghosh's attendance at the Jagannath Dham temple inauguration with Mamata Banerjee sparks outrage. Swapan Dasgupta has criticized Ghosh's actions as a "betrayal," intensifying the internal conflict. This division surfaces amidst the BJP's efforts to challenge Banerjee over the Murshidabad violence, highlighting a significant rift within the party.

title: 'We want justice but ...': Message of unity by wife of Navy officer killed in Pahalgam
content: Amid national grief over the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26, including Navy Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, his wife Himanshi Narwal, a PhD scholar, passionately appealed for peace, urging people not to turn against Muslims or Kashmiris. Lieutenant Narwal was honored with full military honors, and his funeral took place in Karnal, where thousands gathered to pay their respects.

title: Rohit Sharma's reaction goes viral after DRS overturns 'out' call
content: During the Mumbai Indians vs Rajasthan Royals IPL 2025 match, Rohit Sharma's LBW decision was overturned by DRS, sparking laughter and a viral reaction. The incident provided comic relief in the high-stakes game. Riyan Parag chose to bowl first, while Hardik Pandya expressed confidence despite also preferring to bowl, setting the stage for an intense contest.

title: Arshad Nadeem's account blocked in India â€” but not Shahid Afridi's
content: Following a recent terror attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, which resulted in the tragic loss of 26 Indian tourists, Pakistan's Olympic javelin champion Arshad Nadeem's Instagram account has been blocked in India. This action comes as the Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi vows to bring the perpetrators to justice and strengthen the nation's resolve against terrorism.

title: 'US backs India's right to defend itself': Rajnath after call with Hegseth
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth discussed the Pahalgam terror attack, with Hegseth conveying US solidarity and support for India's right to defend itself, according to the defency ministry. Rajnath highlighted Pakistan's role in supporting terrorism, urging global condemnation. This dialogue follows increased tensions and ceasefire violations, prompting India to caution Pakistan and take countermeasures.

title: 'You didn't pay Rs 10 cr for Ashwin to ... ': Harbhajan tears into CSK
content: Chennai Super Kings' disappointing IPL 2025 season has ended with early elimination, raising questions about their strategy, especially regarding Ravichandran Ashwin. The expensive signing has been underutilized, drawing criticism from Harbhajan Singh. He suggests Ashwin's exclusion, despite favorable conditions, cost CSK a crucial match against Punjab Kings, while other underperforming players continue to feature in the team.

title: Sensex rises nearly 4% in April on FII inflows, monsoon hopes & trade optimism
content: Despite geopolitical tensions, the BSE Sensex saw a nearly 4% increase in April, fueled by foreign investment, monsoon forecasts, and trade agreement prospects. Attractive valuations and RBI rate cuts further boosted market sentiment. While Q4 earnings and global cues will influence future performance, analysts remain optimistic about the long-term outlook.

title: 'He's safe': Pregnant wife of BSF jawan in Pakistan custody
content: Rajani Shaw, wife of detained BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw, sought answers in Pathankot regarding her husband's situation in Pakistan. BSF officers in Firozpur assured her that Purnam was safe and his release was likely soon, with talks underway with Pakistan Rangers.

title: CSK call India's fastest T20 centurion for mid-season IPL 2025 trials
content: India's fastest T20 centurion, Urvil Patel, along with Aman Khan and Salman Nizar, participated in mid-season trials for Chennai Super Kings. Patel impressed with scores of 41 off 20 and 50 off 20, drawing praise from CSK members. Despite his impressive Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy performance, he remains unpicked.

title: 31-Year-Old Taxi Driver Arrested For Allegedly Killing His Live-In Partner
content: A 31-year-old taxi driver has been arrested for allegedly killing his live-in partner six months ago in Uttarakhand, Gurugram police said on Thursday.

title: Trump Threatens Countries Purchasing Iranian Oil With Sanctions
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said all purchases of Iranian oil or petrochemicals products must stop and that any country or person buying any from the country would be immediately subject to secondary sanctions.

title: Ties With Pakistan Will Never Improve Until...: Farooq Abdullah
content: Terming Pakistan as a "failed state", National Conference (NC) president Farooq Abdullah Thursday said relations between New Delhi and Islamabad would never improve until a peoples' government is elected in the neighbouring country.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Everyone Of You Will Be Made Answerable, Says Amit Shah
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control (LoC) for the seventh consecutive night on Wednesday.

title: Record Six Rockets Launched In Under 18 Hours Around The World
content: Six rockets lifted off from launchpads across the globe in under 18 hours between Monday and Tuesday.

title: On Way To Receive PM, Shashi Tharoor's Swipe At "Dysfunctional" Delhi Airport
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor today received Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his parliamentary constituency "on time" despite facing delays at the Delhi airport, terming it "dysfunctional".

title: Apple Clocks 28% Growth In iPhone Shipments In India: Report
content: Apple registered 28 per cent growth in iPhone shipments in India (year-on-year) in the first quarter this year (January-March period), industry data showed on Thursday.

title: In Rajnath Singh-Pete Hegseth Call, US Backs India's Right To Defend Itself
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh spoke to US Secretary of Defence, Pete Hegseth, a day after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar spoke to his American counterpart amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: How A First-Time Politician Defeated Canada's PM Candidate Pierre Poilievre In His Own Riding
content: Fanjoy's campaign was built on a foundation of positivity and hard work. "We ran a positive campaign, in remarkable contrast to Pierre's style of politics," he said.

title: Pak Set For Worst Month In Dollar Bonds, Stocks Amid Tensions With India
content: The ongoing tension with India has shaken the confidence of investors in Pakistan badly, setting the country on course to record its worst performance in dollar bonds and stocks since 2023.

title: In Dry Bihar, Ambulance Has No Patient, But Carton After Carton Of Liquor
content: Forty cartons of foreign liquor worth Rs 10 lakh were recovered from an ambulance in Muzaffarpur district of Bihar on Thursday evening, officials said, adding that the vehicle's driver has been arrested.

title: Adani Sportsline To Organise Tennis Tournament In Gujarat's Ahmedabad
content: Adani Sportsline, in collaboration with the Gujarat State Tennis Association (GSTA), will organise the GSTA Tennis Tournament 2025, it was announced here on Thursday.

title: No Brand Names, Prescribing Generic Drugs Should Be A Must: Supreme Court
content: Doctors should only prescribe generic medicines and not any particular brand, as has been ordered in Rajasthan, the Supreme Court remarked today while hearing a petition seeking regulation of unethical marketing practices by pharmaceutical companies.

title: Parent Cannot Be Implicated For Kidnapping Own Child: Punjab High Court
content: A parent cannot be implicated for kidnapping their own child as both the parents are equal natural guardians, the Punjab and Haryana High Court has held while dismissing a plea.

title: "Day We Get Settlement...": Kuki Militants' Umbrella Body Spokesperson On Manipur's Territorial Integrity
content: Seilen Haokip, the spokesperson of the Kuki National Organisation (KNO), also explained the nuances of the words "territorial integrity of Manipur" as mentioned in the ground rules of the suspension of operations (SoO) agreement.

title: Minor Raped For Days By Man She Befriended On Social Media, His Friend In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: A 14-year-old girl from Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh was allegedly raped after being held hostage for three days by a man, whom she had befriended on a social media platform, along with his friend in neighbouring Mandla district, police said.

title: Massive blow! Rajasthan Royals' star ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Rajasthan Royals pacer Sandeep Sharma has been ruled out for the remainder of the IPL 2025 season after sustaining a finger fracture.Despite the injury, he displayed remarkable determination by continuing to bowl in the last match."The franchise extend their best wishes for his full and swift recovery. The team management is currently in the process of finalizing a suitable replacement, with an official announcement expected soon," Rajasthan Royals said in a statement.

title: Shikhar Dhawan's Irish girlfriend makes viral post about their relationship
content: Shikhar Dhawan, following a publicised divorce, is rumoured to be in a relationship with Sophie Shine, an Irish professional based in Abu Dhabi. Speculation ignited after Shine posted a photo of them together, further fueled by public appearances and Dhawan's subtle confirmation of dating someone. Shine, a Product Consultant, reportedly met Dhawan in Dubai, and their bond has grown steadily.

title: Pakistan partially closes Karachi, Lahore airspace till May 31
content: Pakistan's aviation authorities have announced a temporary closure of specific airspace sections over Karachi and Lahore from May 1 to May 31, 2025, citing security concerns. This precautionary measure, implemented daily between 4:00 AM and 8:00 AM, necessitates flight adjustments, including cancellations by Pakistan International Airlines. The closure occurs amidst heightened regional tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack in India.

title: IPL 2025: Why Samson is not playing for RR against MI
content: Rajasthan Royals will face Mumbai Indians without Sanju Samson, who is still recovering from a side strain. Riyan Parag leads the team in his absence, having won the toss and elected to bowl first. The team is also dealing with injuries to key players like Wanindu Hasaranga and Sandeep Sharma, with Kumar Kartikeya and Akash Madhwal stepping in.

title: When Rajiv Gandhi questioned Mandal report move amid Kashmir tension
content: AAP MP Sanjay Singh criticised the government's timing of the caste census announcement, alleging it was a distraction from the Pahalgam terror attack where 26 tourists were killed. He questioned PM Modi's decision to campaign in Bihar instead of addressing the security failure. Interestingly, when former Prime Minister VP Singh had announced the implementation of the Mandal Commission report in 1990, his timing was also questioned by the then opposition led by Congress citing the situation in Kashmir.

title: Dhruv choppers get all clear for ops after safety review
content: Following a thorough investigation into safety issues stemming from a January crash, HAL's ALH Dhruv variants for the Indian Army and Air Force have been cleared for operations. This decision follows recommendations from a Defect Investigation Committee and a phased resumption plan. HAL has defended its platforms against criticism, emphasizing its collaboration with the armed forces.

title: Warships on high alert, Navy intensifies ops in Arabian Sea
content: Amid heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, the Indian Navy has significantly increased its presence in the Arabian Sea. Naval warships are on high alert, conducting anti-ship and anti-aircraft firing exercises within India's EEZ to demonstrate combat readiness. The Indian Coast Guard is also coordinating with the Navy to enhance surveillance near the Gujarat coast.

title: 'Is Buddha needed for Buddhism?' Elon Musk on stepping down from DOGE
content: Elon Musk compared himself to Buddha and his DOGE with Buddhism and said like Buddhism did not stop after Buddha's death, DOGE would not stop functioning after Musk steps away from it to refocus to his businesses. Like Buddhism, DOGE is a way of life and people are converting to it every day, Elon Musk said on his exit from the cost-cutting department of the Trump administration.

title: In charged atmosphere, Pakistan chases ghosts of IAF fighters
content: Pakistan received an official warning about a potential Indian military offensive, leading to heightened tensions and claims of airspace violations. Amidst denials of involvement in a terrorist attack and accusations of escalating tensions, both sides face domestic pressures and international calls for dialogue. With authorized operational freedom for forces and family relocations, the risk of conflict looms large.

title: 'When I didn't see my name in the squad ... ': Suryakumar Yadav
content: Suryakumar Yadav reflected on his Mumbai Indians debut, revealing pre-game jitters and early struggles before becoming a key player. He recounted his pivotal 2018 season, opening unexpectedly and scoring over 500 runs, and shared insights from the tense 2019 IPL final. He made his IPL debut for Mumbai Indians in the 2012 season, playing against Pune Warriors at the Wankhede Stadium. However, his first outing was short-lived as he was dismissed for a duckâ€”the only game he featured in that season.

title: At Book Launch, Jagdeep Dhankhar Calls His Marriage "Lifelong Challenge"
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was seen in a light-hearted mood during the launch of a book on Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel's life on Thursday, drawing laughter from Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and others present.

title: Nepali Student Found Dead At Bhubaneswar KIIT, 2nd Such Case Since February
content: In a push towards digital transformation in healthcare, the Delhi government will implement a comprehensive Health Management Information System (HMIS) across all its hospitals, Health Minister Pankaj Singh said on Thursday.

title: Delhi To Implement Unified Health Information System Across All Hospitals
content: In a push towards digital transformation in healthcare, the Delhi government will implement a comprehensive Health Management Information System (HMIS) across all its hospitals, Health Minister Pankaj Singh said on Thursday.

title: If you ask â€˜Crazyâ€™ Mohan to write dialogues for one film, he will write for four: K.S. Ravikumar
content: 25 books compiling the works, including plays and short stories, of actor and playwright â€˜Crazyâ€™ Mohan released

title: Udhayanidhi launches work on Phase 3 of Chennai Peripheral Ring Road Project
content: The third phase spans 30.10 km from the Tiruvallur Bypass to Sriperumbudur, comprising four bridges and one railway over bridge

title: The people who bear the weight of a divided history
content: Amid a relatively quiet Beating Retreat ceremony that takes place every evening at the Attari-Wagah border are Indians and Pakistanis, who share similar emotions. Some cry and others pray for resilience as nationals from both countries cross borders, leaving family members grieving and in disquiet. Vikas Vasudeva reports from the border villages and Amritsar, just 50 km down the road from Lahore, once its twin city

title: Veteran Congress leader Girija Vyas passes away
content: The former Union Minister had sustained burn injuries during a Gangaur puja ritual at her residence in Udaipur

title: Mallika Sarabhai defies pressure, joins ASHA workersâ€™ protest virtually
content: Ms. Sarabhai participated in the event, â€˜Honorarium for ASHA workersâ€™, a citizenâ€™s crowd funding campaign, by transferring honorarium of â‚¹1,000 to one of the protesting workers

title: Vizhinjam seaport set to boost South Asiaâ€™s maritime trade
content: PM Narendra Modi to dedicate the project to the nation; the seaport will have an AI-driven control room; the new port is expected to reduce Indiaâ€™s dependence on international facilities

title: See AI as a creative enabler, not a job displacer, say industry leaders at WAVES 2025
content: Sessions highlight Indiaâ€™s growing role in content creation and AI-driven storytelling, with emphasis on creativity, skill, and innovation

title: Congress Working Committee meet to seek amendment to remove 50% cap on reservation
content: The Congress says caste census is diversionary tactics; CWC is also likely to reiterate its demand for strong action in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Army, Air Force witness changes at the top brass
content: Lt. Gen. Pratik Sharma is the new Northern Army Commander, Air Marshal Tiwari the Western Air Commander; Air Marshal Ashutosh Dixit takes charge as the Chief of Integrated Defence Staff

title: Army and Air Force versions of ALH Dhruv cleared for operations: HAL
content: The armed forces had temporarily grounded all their ALHs following a crash during a training sortie in January but the Pahalgam terror attack led to the security personnel requiring the services of the helicopter

title: Sonu Nigam sparks row over Kannada song request, invokes Pahalgam attack
content: Singer Sonu Nigam has invited backlash for getting upset with a boy who requested for a Kannada song during his concert in a college in Bengaluru

title: Centre brings raw sugar into regulatory ambit
content: Union government expands Sugar (Control) Order to include raw sugar and khandsari units, aims for better regulation and transparency

title: Opposition attacks Maharashtra CMâ€™s report, cites rural distress and farmer suicides
content: In the 100-day performance report, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that 12 of the 48 departments have performed well and achieved 100% of their targetsÂ

title: Census may be held in 2026 to match delimitation schedule, says Union Minister Kishan ReddyÂ Â
content: According to the 84thÂ Constitutional Amendment Act of 2001, the redrawing of boundaries of the constituencies is to be carried out on the basis of population data of the first Census after 2026. The current seats are drawn on the basis of 1971 Census.

title: Bumper harvest, wheat procurement to cross target: Food Ministry
content: Wheat procurement for the 2025-26 season is progressing without hitches in key States, with the Union Food Ministry reporting 256.31 LMT already secured against this seasonâ€™s target of 312 LMT

title: Pahalgam terror attack: J&K Waqf Board provides job to slain pony operatorâ€™s brother

title: Four die, seven injured in massive fire at hotel in Ajmer

content: Court order is based on an FIR filed by Budgam police in 2020 under sections of UAPA; Fai has 30 days to surrender

title: Man, neighbour killed, three others injured in fire triggered by gas cylinder leak in Bengaluru, son booked for negligence
content: The Madanayakanahalli police have registered an FIR against an 18-year-old student, son of one of the victims, for allegedly triggering the LPG cylinder leak

title: NHRC asks 11 States to protect vulnerable people from heat waves
content: Commission highlights NCRB data showing 3,798 deaths due to heat, sun strokes between 2018 and 2022; calls for changes in working hours, treatment protocols, and shelters equipped with relief materials

title: Maharashtra celebrates Foundation Day with vibrant tributes to heritage, progress
content: On 65th Maharashtra Day, leaders pay homage to martyrs and announce new policy initiatives for State growth

title: The need for a liberal education in a rapidly changing world

content: The initiative focuses on identifying eligible beneficiaries in urban poor communities and linking them to the appropriate schemes

title: NIHL becomes a leading cause of acquired auditory damage
content: Experts at AIISH in Mysuru suggest making noise mapping and hearing screening mandatory across all industries exposed to hazardous noise levels, as noise-induced hearing loss (NIHL) has become a leading cause of acquired auditory damage

title: Chandrababu Naidu virtually inaugurates 11 MSME parks, lays foundation stone for 39 more
content: The Andhra Pradesh government will create at least one MSME park in each constituency. In first phase, MSME parks will be developed in 40 constituencies with an investment of â‚¹2,000 crore, says the Chief Minister
